div.p: Latest News on Status of Spring Sports (4/14/20): VPA Press Release 4/14/20

span.strong: All Spring sports have been postponed until atleast 4/30/20. The VPA will make a decision at that point based on local and
national leader's directions as to whether there will be a spring season.

div.p: Sign-up for Spring Sports is open. Please register your athlete at this link: https://formreleaf.com/organizations/lake-region-union-high-school
Spring Sports include: JV and Varsity Baseball, Softball, Girls Tennis and Track and Field.
Cover Letter and grading/reporting details.
Mailed to homes on 4/14/20. Q3 Report Card with additional details will be mailed on 4/22.
Video link to help understand the grading options:
Updated details.
Please contact Mr. Messier if you have any questions.

p.span: The PSAT scheduled for April 15th has been cancelled.

h2.a: Meal Service for all OCSU families during the COVID-19 school closure

div.p: Please follow this link to the OCSU Meal Service Plan and Survey located at http://www.ocsu.org/meal-services.html
A message to the seniors from Mr. Mess:

GRADUATION: At this point, the graduation ceremony is still scheduled for 2:00pm on June 7. Our hope is that the current social distancing parameters and restictions for group/public gatherings will be different so that communities will be able to celebrate our graduates. Only time will tell.

SCHOLARSHIP QUESTION: Several people have inquired about the scholarships traditionally awarded at graduation. Over $100,000 in local scholarship money is generally awarded at the LRUHS graduation ceremony. The scholarship packets submitted by the seniors have been distributed to all of the local groups and organizations who select the recipients for their respective scholarships. We anticipate that these organizations will continue to make these awards at our graduation ceremony as normal. IF there is no graduation ceremony, the Lake Region guidance department will work with the organizations to facilitate the distribution of the awards, either by providing addresses and contact information to the donors so that they can reach out to the individual awardees of their respective scholarships or by sending awards to the students directly from the guidance office.

2020 YEARBOOKS: Great news on this front. The LR Yearbook crew (Mrs. Mess, Braydon, Hunter, Joel, Jack, Jordyn, Lily & Brooke) FINISHED the yearbook on the last day before the closure and got it submitted to the publishers. Note: The publisher is currently shut down for the time-being, but our yearbook is near the top of their que for production because of when it was submitted. Awesome work Team!!

h2.a: GOVERNOR CLOSES IN-PERSON SCHOOLING FOR REMAINDER OF SCHOOL YEAR

div.p: Message from Superintendent Davis (3/26/2020)

span.span: This evening Governor Scott announced that all schools in Vermont will be closed for the remainder of the school year. The current directive includes that supervisory unions must implement plans for remote learning to students, as well as provide meals for students and childcare for Essential Persons.

As a leadership team, we thought that this might be a directive that would be communicated to us as the rapidly evolving pandemic impacted our state. We have been meeting regularly as an administrative team and with teachers in each of our school buildings to support the switch to remote learning. We will be receiving additional guidance from the Agency of Education about what is expected for student learning for the remainder of the year.
Although none of us wanted this school year to go this way, we will continue to do our best to support students and families.

We love the children who walk through the door each and every day, so we take this directive with the best of intentions to keep them and our families safe while providing our students with opportunities to learn.

As plans unfold, we will be communicating information to families by phone, social media, and information posted on the OCSU website. If you have any questions or need to connect please reach out to the principal of your school or contact the superintendent’s office.

div.p: In an effort to bring connectivity to our district while we engage in distance learning, our PTCA, in collaboration with some other OCSU parent groups, thought it would be a fun activity to have virtual spirit days during the closure. There will be two spirit days each week (Tuesday and Thursday) focused on honoring people and organizations who have been affected by COVID-19. We want our families at home to be able to honor those people who deserve it while having a little fun and enthusiasm. We encourage families to share pictures of their spirit on social media by using the hashtag #OCSUHasSpirit.

Due to the health concerns regarding the COVID-19 outbreak, Monday's (3/23/2020 scheduled meeting of the Lake Region UHS Board will be held virtually. The meeting will be held in accordance of Vermont's Opening Meeting laws and with guidance from the Secretary of State will be conducted in the following manner. The meeting will be held at LRUHS at 6:15pm. At least one (1) Board member must be physically present at the meeting site. Board members and members of the public may "attend" virtually by calling the following phone number: 1-612-421-0989. Callers will then be prompted to input the conference code: 744493. The conference call will open for participants at 6:05pm. Board members and members of the public who choose to attend at the physical site may do so. Those who gather will need to practice recommended social distancing practices.

Note: If there is a need for an Executive Session, the original conference call will remain open, while the Board members call into a second conference call with its unique phone number and code to assure the privacy and confidentiality of the executive session. This was the process recommended by the Secretary of State.

h2.a: FOOD AVAILABLE FOR STUDENTS DURING CLOSURE

div.p: Lunch pick-up will be available starting Monday, March 23, from 11:00-1:00 at the following locations:

ul.li: Albany Community School at the kitchen door at the front corner of the building.
Barton Graded School at the gymnasium entrance.
Brownington Central School at the main entrance.
Glover Community School at the front gymnasium entrance.
Irasburg Village School at the main entrance.
Orleans Elementary School at the side entrance by the parking lot.

div.p: When you arrive at your pick up location please pay attention to the signs and attendants on duty for instructions on the pick up process so that we maintain social distancing. Please do not come to the door and attempt to enter the building.

If you did not pre-register for meals, you can still do so by replying to this email or leaving a message at 754-8467, extension 101. You can also go to a site between 11:00-1:00 on Monday, and they should be able to accommodate your needs.
Thank you and be well.

h2.a: CLASSES ARE CONTINUING via REMOTE LEARNING

div.p: 3/18/20 School Messenger Text

Good Evening Lake Region! Here is your latest COVID update. There is a lot of information to relay in this call so please be patient. The entire text of this call has been posted to the Lake Region website, so if you want to hang up on me now and read the text on the website, I will not be offended!!!

Part 1: Is about the importance of the learning that has been created. All of the teachers have created plans for the next two weeks. Students have access to those plans by accessing the links through the individual teacher pages on the LRUHS website by clicking the “Find a Teacher” link under the Student Resources tab. Most of the students are already aware of this access option and have already communicated with their teachers regarding the work expectations. If your student needs hardcopy materials, books, or devices to assist with learning please contact the school to arrange pickup. There will be personnel in the offices this week.
To continue reading, click the button below.

a.aria-label: Read more: CLASSES ARE CONTINUING via REMOTE LEARNING

h2.a: REMOTE LEARNING INFORMATION FOR COVID SCHOOL CLOSURE

div.p: Message from Principal Messier (3/17/2020)

Good Evening Lake Region Parents. This is principal Andre Messier. Tonight’s is a short message just to reach out and let you know of where we are at with this new model of remote learning that goes into effect tomorrow. Teachers have been communicating with their students this week in person and via email about work expectations during this time, and office staff have also been making personal phone calls to families to arrange for material pick-up. As we all are aware, there is no manual for any of us on how to navigate this issue. School personnel are meeting once again tomorrow to finish ironing the details for our remote learning & teaching model. Once we are set with those details, I will make another call to families to provide everyone with additional information. We will also keep the LRUHS website updated with the latest information. Communication will be vital for everyone to make this work. If you have questions, please call the school and leave a message if you do not get a live person or you can email me or any of the staff. Thank you all for your support, patience, and understanding. #RollRangers
Hello LR Parents and Students,

I want to take this time to introduce myself to families who don’t know me. My name is Deputy Sheriff Jesse Testut, I am the School Resource Officer at Lake Region Union High School. I am here to assist students, families and Lake Region through personal and legal issues. While Lake Region is closed to students over the next couple weeks, I want to extend my services if needed. My contact information is listed below, my cellphone is the best way to contact me.

Deputy Sheriff Jesse Testut
Lake Region Union High School SRO
Orleans County Sheriff's Department
5578 US RT 5 Derby VT 05829
P.O Box 355 Newport VT 05855
Phone (802)334-3333
Direct (802)754-6521 ext 228
Cell (802)673 9287
Email: jtestut@orleanscountysheriff.org
